_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    MFA Agri Service - Burlington Junction

Location:    1101 W Main St., Burlington Junction, MO  64428

Contact:      Ricky Fuller

Phone:             660-725-3302





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of the MFA Agri Service in Burlington Junction are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the West Nodaway Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is a full service farm supply facility.  The facility also handles pesticides, fertilizer, grain, feed, and farm supply products.





3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia", and the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law. 



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA

       Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency

        planning and community right-to-know information as

        required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees will not respond to any release other than to act

ivate an emergency

           shut-off while evacuating the facility. Local emergency responders will be 

           notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is being evaluating the requirements of CGA 2.1, 2014 and Process Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals and will make the required upgrades needed.







    4/29/13
